title: Serif from newsletter
content:
Hello,

I'm trying to find out the name of this typeface.  
Got the picture from a friend, original picture comes from a newsletter.

Thanks in advance,

Niels.

Font: 

 Adobe Caslon 

Solved By: 

 [akira1975](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112150/http:/typophile.com/user/4504 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Schermafbeelding 2014-07-14 om 13.59.26.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112150/http:/typophile.com/files/Schermafbeelding%202014-07-14%20om%2013.59.26.png) | 262.18 KB |
author: Niels B.

comments.content:
The large display type on the bottom is Adobe Garamond Italic with italic alternates (the unusual Q in Quando).

Maggio and the year could be Helvetica, but the sample is so small I can't say for sure.
I stand corrected. Save for the more ornate alternate Q, it's difficult to distinguish between the two...at least before I've had breakfast.
